stories.text: I have heard and experienced that open-source projects have an edge in development speed. Is it the case for you as well? For Jina(an open-source Neural Search framework), it took 1 year to move from v0 to v1; 3 months to move from v1 to v2; and 6 months to move from v2 to v3. And this seems quite impressive to me, given that my other closed-source projects had long development cycle. We have had 205 contributors. Looking forward to hear your experience, do you also feel open-source increased the development speed?
stories.title: Open-Source development speed – Jina Neural Search v2.0 to 3.0 in 6 months

stories.text:
I'm curious where the HN community has found luck finding freelancers for mobile app dev.

I've realized I'm just not going to have enough time to learn how to build for both android and iOS and handle the release cycles for both. I need to find a mobile developer that can build the MVPs so that I, and others, can iterate on them from there. I can find a mobile app developer to knock out MVPs on iOS and Android in a way such that the apps are well documented, tested, and maintainable after they leave the project.

My website was built from scratch using Django and Postgres. It is up and running with Stripe integration (proud of that) so the website provides a working Beta to build off of. The web app that I've built is not complicated -- think something like a TODO app -- but I imagine integrating with the website's existing Postgres database will be tricky. Further, I'll require the mobile app developer be skilled in prompts and notifications for their platform of expertise as well as in managing accessibility features.

Any thoughts on the above places for finding a good mobile app dev, either for iOS, Android, or both?

Tentatively I'm willing to spend $5k to $10k on a contract basis to get this done right.

A couple of areas I've thought of finding mobile app devs:

* Direct messages for referrals on LinkedIn (no luck just yet)

* "Who's Hiring" on HN (haven't posted yet, not sure if consulting is appropriate for this thread)

* https://www.codementor.io/ (hit and miss)

* https://www.lever.co/ (seems like overkill for what I'm after)

* https://www.devteam.space (Had a less than great experience with customer service but thinking of going back)

Please let me know! Thanks.
stories.title: Ask HN: Best place to find a freelance mobile app developer?
